p: Other ideas about drivers of emergence are even harder to test formally. One such is that we are currently living through a ‘perfect storm’ in which many potential drivers of emergence events (such as population growth, urbanization, global travel and trade, intensification of livestock production) are acting in concert (L. King 2005, personal communication). Upward trends in many drivers can be quantified, but it is not entirely clear that the frequency of emergence events is increasing: one recent study suggested that it increased during the first decade of the HIV/AIDS pandemic, but has decreased thereafter [ 9].
